intro: Thlaspi cepaeifolium, commonly known as the cabbage leaf chickweed, is a low-growing, herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its rosette of spoon-shaped, hairy leaves that resemble those of cabbage. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are typical of the mustard family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in gardens and disturbed sites. Thlaspi cepaeifolium is an annual or biennial plant, and it is noted for its ability to tolerate a variety of environmental conditions.
